blurb: An adult playground with a pub heart - arcade, darts, pool, and the kind of giddy energy that makes friends fast. You come for 'a quick one' and accidentally end up staying all night because the room keeps offering new ways to play together. Best for groups, but still forgiving if you're bold enough to arrive solo. Mischief lives here.
whisper: Steal back your night - one game, one grin, one reckless round.

name: The Viaduct
blurb: A historic coaching inn from 1737, famous for its upstairs Bearcat Comedy Night and warm, family-friendly atmosphere.
whisper: Ale, echoes, and ballads — raise a glass to the past.

name: The Victoria (JaguarShoes)
blurb: A Dalston institution where the backroom transforms into a sweaty dance cave, and eclectic DJ sets stretch from dusk until the trains start running.
whisper: Slick floors, loud hearts — the Vic shifts shape after dark.

name: Theatre in the Pound
blurb: At The Cockpit, scratch is taken literally: theatre-makers rent the space for a pound a minute and fling 10–15 minute ideas into the dark, then listen as the room answers back. Theatre in the Pound is low-cost, not-for-profit and gloriously rough-feathered, a night where wild hunches and half-built scenes are carried on a breath of song. If you like the feeling of catching a show mid-moult, before it grows its final plumage, this is your roost, petal.
whisper: Scratch theatre at its barest and boldest.

name: Theatre Peckham
blurb: A multi-award-winning venue championing artistic excellence and social change, amplifying young voices and platforming community experiences.
whisper: Theatre grows wild and brave in the heart of Peckham.

name: Theatre Scratch Night
blurb: The London Art Bar hosts a cosy theatre scratch night just off High Holborn, where brand-new pieces stand up in front of a supportive, wine-sipping crowd. Writers, directors and performers show work at its most vulnerable, then invite thoughts from the room; audience members become part of the creative process, not just observers. It's sheltered beneath the beams and warm as a robin's hollow, especially for petals curious about the making as much as the finished show.
whisper: Soft seats, strong starts — a safe space for scrappy new work.

name: Theatre503
blurb: In a 64-seat room above a pub, Theatre503 launches more first-time writers than any other theatre in the country. Each year over a hundred new pieces of writing take their first breath here, and the audience becomes a co-conspirator in the making of new ideas. You’re right up close to the thinking, watching tomorrow’s debates form before your eyes.
whisper: Tiny stage, big questions; you feel ideas being born.

name: Therapeutic Yoga Community Group – Jane O'Rourke
blurb: In candlelight or soft morning sun, this yoga practice becomes a form of prayer. Trauma-informed, body-honouring, breath-led — Jane's sessions are less about poses and more about presence. Expect nervous system kindness, deep exhale, and the possibility of coming home to yourself.
whisper: In candlelight or soft morning sun, this yoga practice becomes a form of prayer.

name: The Jago
blurb: Dalston’s The Jago is equal parts neighbourhood hub and musical embassy. Its wild, global beats are a joyful, chaotic love letter to sound – expect nights curated by the Beirut Groove Collective playing Lebanese ’60s garage, Arabic disco, Latin tarab and Ethiopian jazz. Jam sessions bring together Gnawa musicians, Afrobeat collectives and UK funk bands under one roof. Go early, stay late and let the wheel of music spin you somewhere new.
whisper: A musical embassy where Lebanese grooves meet Afrobeat jams.

name: TOLA Peckham
blurb: An artist-led bar beneath railway arches where vinyl spins, natural wine flows, and the night unfolds in candlelit warmth until the small hours.
whisper: A Peckham pulse beneath the tracks — hot, loud, alive.

name: Tongue Fu at Rich Mix
blurb: Imagine a band ready to soundtrack your every thought while poets and storytellers leap into the unknown. Tongue Fu is a collision of improvisation and righteous verse, hailed as one of the most entertaining and energetic performances around. Words become weapons, backed by a live band that bends and swells with each syllable. It's revolutionary theatre for your ears and heart.
whisper: Improvised grooves and raging poems make the mic feel like a battleground.

name: Top Cuvée / Shop Cuvée - Natural Wine Masterclass
blurb: Shoreditch's wine den wears no airs - just candlelight, laughter, and glasses that breathe. In this tenderly unruly masterclass, five natural wines unfold like characters in a play, each with its wild edge and wounded grace. A host murmurs tales of soil and maker, grape and gut. Come curious, leave changed. This is not drinking - it's listening, glass to lips.
whisper: Shoreditch's wine den wears no airs - just candlelight, laughter, and glasses that breathe.

name: Top Secret Comedy Club
blurb: Hidden down a Drury Lane staircase, this intimate basement club promises top-quality stand-up every night of the week. Top Secret's team curate varied line-ups and keep ticket prices low, creating an atmospheric space loved by audiences and touring comics alike. Celebrity drop-ins and a cheap bar make it feel like London's best kept secret.
whisper: A basement bursting with secret smiles

name: TouchUnwind
blurb: For when your nervous system wants quiet company more than conversation. Sessions are built on explicit consent — nothing is assumed, and touch is never owed. It can be simple as hand-holding, side-by-side presence, or a carefully chosen cuddle shape, all negotiated in real time. A calm, human kind of reset — guided by clarity, not pressure.
whisper: Nothing to prove. Just breath, boundaries, and kind attention.

name: Tramshed
blurb: A community arts hub using performing arts to serve young people and adults with learning differences, fostering social cohesion through creativity.
whisper: Stories spark and bridges build under Woolwich skies.

name: Treadwell's Bookshop - Witchcraft Classes
blurb: Behind the dusky glass and whispered shelves, Treadwell's gathers the curious and the initiated alike. Its witchcraft classes thread ritual with history, herbs with symbols. This is no marketplace of tricks - but a library of power, quietly lit, where magic is studied, respected, and made real.
whisper: The lamp is lit — come learn where ink meets incantation.

name: Trinity Church Hall (Enfield)
blurb: A classic dance-club setting: chairs around the edge, familiar tunes, and a room that's gently determined to include you. You'll be guided, partnered, swapped, and quietly adopted by the friendliness of it all. Not flashy — but deeply nourishing.
whisper: A local hall that knows how to welcome.

name: Troy Bar
blurb: Troy Bar is an old-school Shoreditch soul den that has refused to chase trends. Its rich tapestry of live music includes Tuesday open-mic sessions, Word Of Mouth jazz-funk jams, and midweek nights showcasing emerging talent alongside plates of homemade Caribbean cuisine. Legendary jam nights encourage musicians to jump on stage, and Thursdays are dedicated to live reggae singers backed by seasoned bands. With rum punch, jam-packed grooves and an inclusive spirit, Troy Bar makes every night feel like a house party you never want to leave.
whisper: Rum punch, open mics and reggae jams make this Shoreditch den home.

name: Truth to Power Café
blurb: This internationally acclaimed theatre event invites participants to answer one simple question: who has power over you and what do you want to say to them? It blends memoir, testimony and political resistance into a live call-and-response. Reviews call it stunning theatrical activism – a cathartic, communal act of truth-telling that cuts straight to the heart.
whisper: Stand up, name your oppressor and speak your truth – the room will hold you.

name: TT London - Whisky Tasting Experience
blurb: In a North London studio, alchemy is sipped, not spilled. Seven whiskies - smoky, honeyed, brash and shy - are poured like myth into glass, each one a map of time and terrain. A cocktail to begin, and then a slow descent into the oak-aged depths. This is no frat boy fire - it's reverence in amber. For those who taste memory on the tongue.
whisper: In a North London studio, alchemy is sipped, not spilled.

name: Turner & George - Beef Butchery Class
blurb: When the butcher's lights dim, four aprons await. At Turner & George, this after-hours session slices straight into the primal - a whole fore-rib of beef, broken down by your hands and the master's blade. Each cut is explained with reverence. Then comes the feast: a steak dinner with wine, and parcels of meat to carry home like trophies. A carnivore's catechism, quietly taught in bone and flame.
whisper: When the butcher's lights dim, four aprons await.

name: Turning Earth Hoxton
blurb: Clay is honest work: it asks you to slow down, to listen with your palms. Turning Earth has that rare makerspace feel — busy, welcoming, quietly devotional to process. Come here when you want your thoughts to settle into shape.
whisper: Let your hands do what your mind can't solve.

name: TwickFolk at The Cabbage Patch
blurb: A volunteer-run folk club thriving since 1983, where voices rise over acoustic guitars in a Twickenham pub, keeping the old songs alive.
whisper: Strings, stories, and song — West London’s folk fire still burns.

name: Two Brewers
blurb: For over forty years I've been serving the LGBTQIA+ community with camp cabaret and drag extravaganzas. Seven nights a week my stage explodes with glitter and feathers, while the bar hums with laughter and long‑time friendships. I'm not a tourist trap – I'm a South London institution where queens, queers and allies pack in for karaoke, comedy and spectacular shows. Expect sequins on the floor and love in the air.
whisper: South London's glitter‑soaked drag den that never sleeps.

name: UCL Observatory Public Tours
blurb: On clear nights, the domes of Mill Hill open to the public and the universe gets a little closer. UCL Observatory's historic telescopes offer glimpses of craters, rings and distant galaxies, guided by astronomers who remember that wonder is the beginning of science. Dark skies and infinite questions.
whisper: Historic domes opening onto infinite dark

name: Umbrella Workshop - Irish Whiskey Tasting
blurb: Hidden behind Shoreditch's bustle, the Umbrella Workshop whispers warmth. Here, twelve souls gather in the hush of cut glass and cured meats, their lips kissed by Poitín and Irish malts. There is nothing rushed - only stories steeped in smoke, small pours poured with purpose, and a lingering that becomes its own devotion. The night folds in like a cloak. Let it.
whisper: Hidden behind Shoreditch's bustle, the Umbrella Workshop whispers warmth.

name: Underbelly Boulevard Soho
blurb: Underbelly Boulevard Soho is Underbelly’s first permanent venue, born from a legacy of award-winning festivals and events. The ‘vibrant and dynamic entertainment destination’ promises theatre, comedy, variety and cabaret alongside a beautiful cocktail bar. Set in the revived Boulevard Theatre site in Walker’s Court, it captures the bohemian spirit of Soho’s past while pushing boundaries with new performances every week.
whisper: Boulevard ghosts dance anew; cocktails clink and the stage rebels at Soho’s heart.

name: Union Chapel
blurb: A working church and not-for-profit performance space where gothic architecture and exceptional acoustics frame diverse programming.
whisper: Where music meets mercy and the walls still pray.

name: Unit 58
blurb: Head north to this DIY-feeling warehouse and you'll be rewarded with one of London's most refreshing dance spaces. Unit 58's high ceilings, mezzanine and sparkling disco ball create a euphoric playground for everything from disco and donk to psytrance and garage. The staff are warm, the crowd is wild and the parties burn hot until sunrise. Come ready to sweat and leave any pretence at the door.
whisper: Glitter and grin under a giant disco ball in a north-London warehouse.

name: Unlocked Shoreditch
blurb: I inhabit a former squat rave in Shoreditch that's been transformed into a multidisciplinary events space and creative hub. My programme features everything from melodic house to global bass. There's an art‑gallery energy in my brickwork and a club‑night intensity in my nights; our community of DJs, designers and dancers blurs the lines between scenes. Step through my doors and unlock something unexpected.
whisper: A repurposed squat where art school meets after‑hours euphoria.

name: Up the Creek Comedy Club
blurb: This legendary Greenwich venue — once home to Malcolm Hardee — promises unpredictable nights of laughter. Time Out calls it 'one of the best places to see live comedy'. Regular shows mix household names with rising stars, and the Blackout brings new talent face-to-face with a lively crowd.
whisper: A Greenwich institution where anything can happen

name: Upstairs at the Ritzy
blurb: Above Brixton’s historic Ritzy cinema is a cosy room that turns into a living-room dance floor at night. Open-mic sessions, soul and funk DJs and blues jam nights invite locals and travellers into its warm embrace. It’s a place where you can sink into a worn sofa with a pint, then suddenly be pulled into a circle of strangers crooning to Otis Redding. The nights feel intimate and improvised, like a family gathering around a record player.
whisper: An old cinema’s attic where soul and funk make strangers family.

name: Vauxhall City Farm
blurb: Minutes from MI6 and the London Eye, this 1.5-acre farm brings a piece of the countryside to central London. Vauxhall City Farm is an educational charity that offers all the sights and smells of rural life, from alpacas to compost heaps. Free entry (donations welcome) and opening hours Tuesday–Sunday make it easy to drop in, volunteer or join a horticultural or crafts workshop. Grab a tea from the Old Dairy café and let the alpacas remind you not to take yourself too seriously.
whisper: Alpacas and skyscrapers coexist here like old friends.

name: Venue MOT Unit 18
blurb: A grungy warehouse space in Barking where east London's underground gathers, sweat drips from industrial ceilings, and the music pounds until daybreak.
whisper: Rough and righteous — sound shakes the walls in Barking’s best-kept secret.

name: VFD
blurb: Known affectionately as 'the basement of dreams', I'm an incubator of queer arts tucked under a kebab shop. I've nurtured emerging and superstar performers alike, with late‑night cabaret, drag shows and art happenings that blur nightlife and activism. Our Femmifesto commits us to being a safer space: positive consent, celebration of all bodies and social revolution through partying. Join us underground and let's conspire with glitter.
whisper: A queer basement where art, bodies and revolution collide in sequins.

name: Viktor Wynd Museum
blurb: Part cabinet of curiosities, part occult parlour, The Viktor Wynd Museum is Hackney's most deliciously haunted corner. Taxidermy, erotica, bones and bottled oddities — every inch whispers. Beneath it all, candlelit talks and ritual nights conjure the weird and the wondrous. Enter if you dare… and if you delight in the macabre.
whisper: Wonder leans toward the wicked in this shrine of strangeness.

name: Village Underground
blurb: A renovated Victorian warehouse topped with hollowed-out Jubilee line carriages, offering a blank canvas for independent arts and music.
whisper: Steel dreams and street art rise in this warehouse of sonic awakenings.

name: Vortex Jazz Club
blurb: The Vortex doesn't just host jazz — it breathes it. Inside this Dalston corner, melody and memory blur as horns wail and cymbals shiver. It's a space where strangers nod in time and improvisation leads the way. Sunday jams spill warmth like whisky, and every evening feels like a secret kept in plain sight.
whisper: The Vortex doesn't just host jazz — it breathes it.

name: VQ Bloomsbury (24-Hour Café & Diner)
blurb: Not indie in the strictest sense, but a stalwart for students and shift-workers in need of a table at 3am. Open 24 hours, this Bloomsbury café-diner serves breakfast and comfort food around the clock, with free wifi and a steady churn of fellow night people. It's more fluorescent than fairy-lit, but when the deadline looms and every other door is closed, VQ becomes a surprisingly tender kind of nest.
whisper: All-night coffee, cracked laughter, and deadline dreams.

name: Walworth Garden
blurb: A patch of green that doesn't ask you to be shiny. You come as you are, put your hands in soil, and let the day soften around you. The work is small, real, and quietly communal - the kind that rebuilds a person without making a fuss about it.
whisper: Hands in soil; breath returns to its proper pace.

name: Walworth Garden Incense Making Workshop
blurb: Held in the lush surroundings of Walworth Garden, this workshop delves into the ancient, devotional art of incense. You'll work with premium resins, herbs, fruits, flowers, seeds, spices and essential oils selected for their historic, therapeutic and magical resonance. Over a day you grind, blend and roll incense, learning about the cultural histories of smoke and scent. It feels part apothecary, part ritual – you leave with cones and sticks imbued with your own intention.
whisper: Resin and spice ground between stone; smoke rising with your thoughts.

name: We Make Books
blurb: Tucked into the quiet curve of Belfast Road, We Make Books offers a sanctuary for the book-obsessed and curious of hand. Here, you'll stitch Belgian secrets, press Tetrapak prints, and conjure zines with quiet care. The ink smells of story; the folded paper holds memory. It's a space for slow making - deliberate, tactile, a hymn to the enduring spell of craft.
whisper: Fold, trim, stitch — the book becomes body at this print-lover’s workshop.

name: We The Conscious
blurb: Tucked inside a converted printworks at Hackney Downs Studios, We The Conscious is a breath-led studio built around a quadraphonic sound system and soft lighting. Weekly group journeys and private sessions weave circular breathing with psychosomatic inquiry, sensory tools and curated music to recalibrate the nervous system. It's not yoga and it's not therapy – it's a modern ritual for those who want to feel everything.
whisper: Quadraphonic waves, dim light, and breath as anchor – Hackney's sound-bath for your lungs.

name: WellNest (Fire & Ice / Rewind & Revive)
blurb: WellNest's 'Fire & Ice' sessions on Crucifix Lane are equal parts breathwork and contrast therapy. Participants begin with calming breathwork to prepare the body before moving through rounds in a Himalayan salt sauna and cold plunge pods. Huminga Wellness' monthly 'Rewind & Revive' events, also hosted at WellNest, start with grounding meditation and vitality breathwork, then lead into sauna and ice baths to reset the nervous system. It's the Wim Hof principle without the machismo – a soft, heart-led way to build resilience.
whisper: Sweat, plunge, breathe – your nervous system recalibrated in two hours.

name: West London Queer Project Drag Makeup Masterclass – Serve
blurb: West London Queer Project's 'Serve' masterclass is drag makeup as ritual: a three-part course that starts with blocking brows and ends with contouring and colour that defies gender. NYX Professional Makeup sponsors the kit, but the real gift is guidance from seasoned drag artists who help you paint a new face, experiment with glitter and shape, and talk about the history of drag. Beginners are encouraged to play; the mirror becomes a portal, not a judge.
whisper: Bold colours and laughter as a new face appears from the powder.

name: Westminster Kingsway College – Regent's Park Centre
blurb: A passport-stamp kind of evening: dances from everywhere, taught clearly, then danced together until they start to feel like yours. Expect circles, lines, partners, changes — and the gentle thrill of learning a country with your feet. Come curious; leave humming.
whisper: A world-tour, danced in a single room.

name: Westminster Quaker Meeting – Drop-in Silence
blurb: Every Friday evening the Westminster Quaker Meeting opens its doors for a free drop-in silence session between 5:30 and 7:00 pm. You can sit for as long as you like and leave whenever you need; the shared silence offers a simple, profound refuge from the week. There's no agenda or teaching — just a communal quiet that invites inner listening.
whisper: A room where time loosens, chairs circle and stillness is shared without words.

name: Wheel of Consent Weekend Workshop
location: Private studio in London (exact location shared with participants upon booking)
blurb: Beneath every touch is a question: Is this for you, or for me? In this quiet, potent weekend, participants learn to name their desires, honour their boundaries, and listen with their whole being. The Wheel of Consent isn't just a framework - it's a doorway to deeper, kinder knowing.
whisper: Touch finds its truth when power is named and honoured.

name: Wicca Moon Workshops
blurb: At Wicca Moon, a pagan shop tucked into Eltham, workshops are taught by practising witches. You might learn candle magic, goddess rituals, divination or how to work with herbs and oils. Classes are small and hands-on, blending lore with practice; you'll dress candles, stir potions, meditate and call in energies. It feels like stepping into a coven – a safe, queer-friendly space where the old ways are honoured and the modern city fades away.
whisper: Herbs crackle, candles drip and you feel the circle close.

name: Wild Food UK - Foraging Courses
blurb: Among Hampstead's tangled roots and hedgerows, a different kind of wisdom grows. Led by Wild Food UK, these foraging walks trace edible stories across bark and bramble - mushrooms like hidden prayers, greens with ancient names. You'll never look at nettles the same again. This is London as larder, wild and whispering.
whisper: Among Hampstead's tangled roots and hedgerows, a different kind of wisdom grows.

name: Wilton's Music Hall
blurb: The oldest surviving Grand Music Hall in the world, a Grade II* listed building staging extraordinary theatre and music in candlelit atmosphere.
whisper: A faded velvet marvel where ghosts and gin share the aisle.

name: Wonders of the Dark Sky - Woodoaks Farm Stargazing
location: Woodoaks Farm, Maple Cross, Hertfordshire (north-west Greater London)
blurb: At Woodoaks Farm, the stars return. Far from London's glare, telescopes are trained on Saturn's rings and galaxy light. It's a one-night reverence for the cosmos - where skywatchers gather by lantern and thermos, and the night stretches vast, ancient, and alight with possibility.
whisper: At Woodoaks Farm, the stars return.

name: Wonderville
blurb: On Haymarket, just steps from Piccadilly Circus, Wonderville is a purpose-built intimate cabaret club with table seating. Formerly Planet Hollywood, the venue has reinvented itself as a home for magic and cabaret, with performances from Tuesday to Sunday and weekend matinees. Step inside for close-up conjuring, comedy and burlesque mixed with cocktails – a playful playground where nothing is quite as it seems.
whisper: Haymarket’s neon hides a secret parlour of wonders where nothing stays still.

name: Woolwich Front Room
blurb: A community 'front room' in the truest sense - where people gather, make, speak, and slowly belong. When writing happens here, it's not about polish; it's about having a voice in the room and a place at the table. Come for gentle connection and the kind of creativity that builds community stitch by stitch.
whisper: A front room with a kettle-on feeling - stories welcome here.

name: Woolwich Works
blurb: Time Out's 'best new culture spot,' a multi-disciplinary hub on the Royal Arsenal championing contemporary music, theatre, and dance.
whisper: Riverlight and reinvention — Woolwich hums with new fire.

name: Word Space (Kraft Dalston)
blurb: Word Space is a pay-what-you-can series of poetry socials, workshops and open mics founded by Joshua Hallam. Designed as a community rather than a competition, it invites people to share drafts, give feedback and breathe together. Word Space is as much about listening as performing – it’s about the breath after a full stop and the warmth of someone telling you they loved your third line.
whisper: Pens, pencils and daydreams meet in a room where listening is half the art.

name: Workshops for Self-Discovery
blurb: Therapeutic creative writing that's built for humans, not 'writers'. Prompts open the door; free-writing does the rest - surprising, honest, sometimes a little wild. Your work can stay private, or be witnessed. Either way, the point is the same: to let the page tell the truth more easily than your mouth can.
whisper: Prompts as keys - the page as a safe room.

name: Wormwood Scrubs Pony Centre
blurb: Founded in 1989, this inner-city Riding for the Disabled Association school provides a safe space for children and young people, many with learning or physical disabilities. The centre's mission is to improve quality of life through riding and caring for ponies; over the years it has grown from three ponies to a stable yard with horses, ponies and two donkeys. Volunteers are integral and visitors are invited to help fundraise or simply offer a hand. It's a place where the simple act of brushing a pony can rebuild confidence.
whisper: Ponies here listen better than most people you know.

name: Wuntanara
blurb: West African drums, taught with warmth and a steady pulse - the kind that meets beginners kindly and still thrills the seasoned. You learn by doing, by listening, by laughing at the wobble and finding the groove anyway. It's not performance-first; it's life-first. Come to be re-tuned by rhythm and carried a little by the group.
whisper: A drumline that steadies you - and then lifts you.

name: XOYO
blurb: Sitting right by Old Street station, XOYO has spent over a decade proving itself with a killer sound system and a reputation for booking global heavyweights alongside local heroes. The two-floor space hums with energy whether it's a weeknight student rave or a sold-out jungle marathon. Steps from the tube yet worlds away, it's the kind of club where you come for one act and end up staying until the lights come on.
whisper: Just off the roundabout, the night spirals into a blur of bass and sweat.

name: Yaran Women's Club – Dance Therapy
blurb: Yaran means 'friends' in Persian, and this Finchley women's club embodies that warmth. Dance therapy sessions create safe space for movement as medicine — processing, releasing, reconnecting. No performance, no judgement, just women moving through what words cannot hold.
whisper: Healing through movement in warm sisterhood

name: Ye Olde Cheshire Cheese
blurb: Step under a low lintel and into a labyrinth of oak-panelled rooms warmed by roaring fires. This 17th-century tavern feels like a warren of stories – descend into its cellars and you'll find vaulted chambers where Samuel Johnson once drank. There is comfort in its dim corners and the sense that every joke, argument and secret has been absorbed into the smoke-darkened beams.
whisper: Oak and smoke hold secrets like embers under ash.

name: Yeah Ok! Poetry Night (Battersea Arts Centre)
blurb: Held monthly at the beautiful Battersea Arts Centre, Yeah Ok! Poetry Night features two guest poets and a generous open-mic. The evening begins with a poetry workshop to help you polish your lines and ends with a half-hour jam for chatting and sharing ideas. It’s relaxed, creative and perfect for trying out new work.
whisper: Work on your poem, read it to strangers, then stay for the jam and the joy.

name: You Are Loved LGBTQ+ Bereavement Support Groups
blurb: You Are Loved is a non-profit founded in 2024 to create a safe space for LGBTQ+ people grieving loved ones lost to suicide or drugs. Their aim is to provide judgment-free, peer-led support that understands the unique circumstances of queer bereavement. They are the first organisation offering national LGBTQ+ focused bereavement peer support groups, with the first in-person meetings held in South London in April 2025 and continuing weekly. Groups are facilitated by queer-specialised psychotherapists and volunteers with lived experience who foster warmth, safety and understanding.
whisper: A circle where queer grief is seen, held and met with compassionate kinship.

name: Yougi Candle-Making Workshop
blurb: Yougi's candle workshops invite you to pour intention into wax. Using eco-soy wax and essential oils, you learn to melt, blend and pour your own aromatherapy candle. The scent combinations are personal – lavender for calm, citrus for joy – and the act of stirring wax becomes a kind of meditation. You leave with a candle to light when you need to remember the afternoon you melted, scented and solidified your mood.
whisper: Melted wax cooling while your intentions harden alongside it.

name: Yougi Perfume-Making Workshop
blurb: In a bright studio off Spitalfields, Yougi's perfumers guide you through the alchemy of scent. The 90-minute workshop begins with an introduction to aromatherapy and the ways scent affects mood. You learn about top, heart and base notes, sniff ethically sourced essential oils and blend them into a fragrance that is wholly yours. The class is unhurried and mindful – more about how you want to feel than how you want to smell – and you leave with a bottle of your own perfume and a quiet grin.
whisper: Inhale, exhale, blend; your own scent blooms between your palms.

name: Zodiac Bar, Club & Karaoke
blurb: Between Camden and Soho, I'm a trans‑owned, trans‑run venue that bloomed from pop‑up parties into a full‑time home. I welcome the entire LGBTQ+ family and our allies with a warm hug, nightly karaoke, quizzes and regular cabaret and drag bingo. Split across two levels, I offer chilled drinks upstairs and a basement club for private hire or late‑night mischief. We're independently run through community investment, so every note you sing helps support queer visibility and joy.
whisper: Trans‑run karaoke bar where drag bingo and late‑night mischief thrive.
